Summary for redditors.
- North Korea try to assassinate the dictator of South Korea in the 1974 but kill his wife instead - A former policeman turned preacher/cult leader, Choi Tae-min, contacts the dictators daughter (Park Gun-hye) and says she can speak to her mother through him - He gains unlimited influence over her and earns huge sums for access to her and the government - The dictator is assassinated in 1979 and a military dictator takes over, thus the cult leader loses his influence and fades into the background but still has control over Park Gun Hye - In 1990 Park Gun-hye's sister writes to the government asking them to save her sister from the grips of Choi Tae-min - Choi Tae-min dies in 1994 and his daughter Choi Sun-sil takes over influence of Park Gun-hye - In 1997 Park Gun Hye starts her political career and becomes an elected official in 1998 - In 2007 she runs for President but loses her parties nomination. At this point the US embassy points out to the US government about her history with the cult leader - In 2012 she runs again and wins the Presidential election. Choi Sun-sil is in charge of producing the inauguration ceremony - Her behaviour as President is erratic and she rarely gives press conferences. Her speeches are described as rambling and full of strange wording - Fast forward to 2016 and there is a scandal about Choi Sun-sil's daughter getting in to a prestigious Korean university and preferential treatment despite not getting the grades or attending classes - Choi Sun-sil and her daughter flee to Germany to get away from the scandal - One of the major news channels find a tablet in Choi Sun-sil's former office which contains evidence that she was given confidential government files including upcoming Park Gun-hye speeches and government policies despite not holding a post in the government - Park apologises but says that she no longer consults Choi and hasn't since the early days of her Presidency - There is more evidence from the files and witnesses that Choi had complete influence over Park, from rewriting speeches to choosing/making her clothes for official engagements, and was doing so right up to earlier this year - Choi has strong armed Korean conglomerates in to donating money to her 'foundations' (slush funds), threatening them that their businesses will be harmed by government decisions if they don't - Choi apparently leads a select group of 8 advisors including a gigolo and a K-pop video director who control everything Park does and shamanistic rituals regularly take place at government buildings (speculation at the moment)
